DESCRIPTOR.STUDY_TITLE: Transcriptome and epigenomic landscape of cytotrophoblasts from normal and HDP placentas
DESCRIPTOR.STUDY_ABSTRACT: Hypertensive isorders of pregnancy (HDP) is a severe pregnancy-related disorder that poses significant risks to both maternal and fetal health. Dysfunctional placental development is one of the major contributors to the onset of HDP. In this study, we investigated the gene expression and epigenomic modifications in cytotrophoblasts from normal and HDP placentas. The information obtained in this study contributes to the growing body of knowledge aimed at improving the diagnosis, management, and treatment of HDP.

STUDY_ATTRIBUTE.VALUE: Kumamoto University Institute of Molecular Embryology and Genetics
Cytotrophoblasts from normal and HDP placentas
Trophoblast stem cells derived from normal and HDP placentas
